cluster_relations.rel_desc: The spread of urban legends extends across multiple regions.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Spatial Reach & Geography of Story Dissemination

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The spread of urban legends extends across continents.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Spatial Reach & Geography of Story Dissemination

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The spread of urban legends, exemplified by the Hook Man story, reaches around the world.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Spatial Reach & Geography of Story Dissemination

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: FormVariation: various narrative forms and variations

remarks: Uses Hook Man as a representative instance of urban legend spread.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates the geographic extent or coverage area over which a phenomenon, process, or dissemination (such as the spread of urban legends) occurs.
args.justification: All three relations link the spread of urban legends (a dissemination phenomenon) to geographic scopes (regions, continents, around the world) with rel_hint_type='spatial reach'. A single predicate 'has_spatial_reach' consistently captures that the subject's extent is the specified spatial area.
args.remark: Normalized previous variants like 'occurs_in' and 'reaches' into one spatial-extent predicate.

args.justification: Each relation expresses the extent of spread or dissemination in space rather than a simple location membership. Grouping them under 'spatial_reach_relation' distinguishes these from generic location/occurs_in relations.
The core semantic dimension is spatial: how far the urban legends spread geographically (regions, continents, around the world). This fits the broad spatial category.
